segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 42
segments.en: Linked Discourses 42

segments.pli: 1. Gāmaṇivagga
segments.en: 1. Chiefs

segments.pli: 6. Asibandhakaputtasutta
segments.en: 6. With Asibandhaka’s Son

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṃ viharati pāvārikambavane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā in Pāvārika’s mango grove.

segments.pli: Atha kho asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Asibandhaka’s son the chief went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udakorohakā aggiparicārakā.
segments.en: “Sir, there are western brahmins draped with moss who carry pitchers, immerse themselves in water, and serve the sacred flame.

segments.pli: Te mataṃ kālaṅkataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.
segments.en: When someone has passed away, they truly lift them up, raise them up, and guide them along to heaven.

segments.pli: Bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā”ti?
segments.en: But what about the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha: is he able to ensure that the whole world will be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm when their body breaks up, after death?”

segments.pli: “Tena hi, gāmaṇi, taññevettha paṭipucchissāmi. Yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsīti.
segments.en: “Well then, chief, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: idhassa puriso pāṇātipātī adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhiko.
segments.en: Take a person who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, and have wrong view.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ mahājanakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: And a large crowd comes together to offer up prayers and praise, circumambulating them with joined palms and saying:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatū’ti.
segments.en: ‘When this person’s body breaks up, after death, may they be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm!’

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: api nu so puriso mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā”ti?
segments.en: Would that person be reborn in heaven because of their prayers?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, gāmaṇi, puriso mahatiṃ puthusilaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.
segments.en: “Chief, suppose a person were to throw a broad rock into a deep lake.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: And a large crowd was to come together to offer up prayers and praise, circumambulating it with joined palms, and saying:

segments.pli: ‘ummujja, bho puthusile, uplava, bho puthusile, thalamuplava, bho puthusile’ti.
segments.en: ‘Rise, good rock! Float, good rock! Float to shore, good rock!’

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: api nu sā puthusilā mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā ummujjeyya vā uplaveyya vā thalaṃ vā uplaveyyā”ti?
segments.en: Would that broad rock rise up or float because of their prayers?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, gāmaṇi, yo so puriso pāṇātipātī adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhiko.
segments.en: “In the same way, take a person who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, and have wrong view.

segments.pli: Kiñcāpi taṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: Even though a large crowd comes together to offer up prayers and praise …

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatū’ti, atha kho so puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.
segments.en: when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: idhassa puriso pāṇātipātā paṭivirato adinnādānā paṭivirato kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato musāvādā paṭivirato pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato samphappalāpā paṭivirato anabhijjhālu abyāpannacitto sammādiṭṭhiko.
segments.en: Take a person who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re contented, kind-hearted, and have right view.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: And a large crowd comes together to offer up prayers and praise, circumambulating them with joined palms and saying:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatū’ti.
segments.en: ‘When this person’s body breaks up, after death, may they be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell!’

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: api nu so puriso mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā”ti?
segments.en: Would that person be reborn in hell because of their prayers?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, gāmaṇi, puriso sappikumbhaṃ vā telakumbhaṃ vā gambhīre udakarahade ogāhetvā bhindeyya. Tatra yāssa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa; yañca khvassa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhaṃ gāmi assa.
segments.en: “Chief, suppose a person were to sink a pot of ghee or oil into a deep lake and break it open. Its shards and chips would sink down, while the ghee or oil in it would rise up.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: And a large crowd was to come together to offer up prayers and praise, circumambulating it with joined palms and saying:

segments.pli: ‘osīda, bho sappitela, saṃsīda, bho sappitela, adho gaccha, bho sappitelā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Sink, good ghee or oil! Descend, good ghee or oil! Go down, good ghee or oil!”

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
segments.en: What do you think, chief?

segments.pli: api nu taṃ sappitelaṃ mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā osīdeyya vā saṃsīdeyya vā adho vā gaccheyyā”ti?
segments.en: Would that ghee or oil sink and descend because of their prayers?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, gāmaṇi, yo so puriso pāṇātipātā paṭivirato, adinnādānā paṭivirato, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato, musāvādā paṭivirato, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato, samphappalāpā paṭivirato, anabhijjhālu, abyāpannacitto, sammādiṭṭhiko,
segments.en: “In the same way, take a person who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re contented, kind-hearted, and have right view.

segments.pli: kiñcāpi taṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya:
segments.en: Even though a large crowd comes together to offer up prayers and praise …

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatū’ti, atha kho so puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā”ti.
segments.en: when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Asibandhaka’s son the chief said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “abhikkantaṃ, bhante … pe …
segments.en: “Excellent, sir! …

segments.pli: ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā…

suttaplex.blurb: The chief Asibandhakaputta asks whether the rituals advocated by the western brahmins can bring a person to heaven. The Buddha asserts that only good deeds can take you to a good rebirth, and rituals have no effect.
